data.title: Super friendly staff
data.text: Have never had a bad meal here for the price. The soup bar comes with every meal and is always very tasty.  I especially like the patty melt. Their French fries are very good as well. Service was quick. Have also been here for breakfast. Loved the breakfast bar and the omelette.

data.title: Biscuit and gravy
data.text: i usually don't like to say anything bad about restaurants but the biscuits and gravy here is like wall paper paste. Sorry, just being honest. My husband like his omelet.

data.title: Quick, Fresh, Delicious Food
data.text: We had dinner here one night during our visit to Greenfield Village and the Henry Ford Museum. It was a week night and it was not crowded. We were seated quickly and our waitress was at our table immediately with water. She was very friendly and helpful. The cuisine is American with Lebanese specialties. Breakfast is served all day and I tried the bacon and eggs which were prepared as ordered. It was a generous order with jumbo eggs, 4 slices of bacon, hashbrowns and toast. Very good! My husband tried the chicken shawarma rolled sandwich. Our waitress told him what to order for the sandwich and her recommendations were delicious. The food came out quickly and was hot and delicious. Our waitress was very attentive. We recommend this place.

data.title: Great Salad Bar
data.text: Leon's is a great resturant.  The food selections is abundant.  The breakfacts, lunch and dinners are very tasty.  They have an excellant salad and soup bar with many soup's to chose from.  They also have a wonderful breakfast bar.

data.title: Wanted to barf
data.text: Me and my family went in for dinner tonight.  Seemed like a friendly family place.  We were seated right away. Waitress was friendly and quick with service.  Me and my husband both ordered the nightly special. He ordered the beef tips and noodles I ordered the lemon chicken.  Kids ordered a burger and a breakfast.  I mentioned to my husband the place was really empty for being dinner time.  We both got the soup bar with our meals and salads and bread.  All seemed great.  Then...... Dinner came.  My daughter nearly got sick at the table. Hers was very funky tasting.  My son's burger and fries was fine.  My husbands and mine food was soooooooo gross. The beef tips were in a red tomato sauce.  The lemon chicken was served as some wierd stir fry style dish and the chicken was so hard I could not even cut it.  We tried to be brave and stomach it but we both left feeling sick.  Service was great but I will never return.

data.title: Typical diner
data.text: Nothing special about this place,  but consistent quality food.  Never been disappointed by a bad meal.

data.title: "A plus for Taylor"
data.text: Food quality is about the same, as it is in the other restaurants that belong to the family- owned chain. What makes this one stand out, is that the service is much better, here. I feel intimidated when I visit their other locations.

data.title: A special place for me
data.text: Leon's is a small local "chain" of restaurants.  They are located in Dearborn, Taylor, Garden City, and Livonia MI.  I have eaten at Leon's for many years and always had good food there.  I have also been to the Taylor location for several dinners for special occasions at work too.  A number of years ago I had my wedding reception at the Taylor location.  Karim, the manager at the Taylor location,  could not have been more helpful.  He personally saw to the  preparation of the chicken for our dinner as it is his "specialty".   Several of the guests, who are very fussy about the quality of food, later complimented us on the meal which was served.  Although the banquet room is not very large it can handle a nice size group.   I personally think the decor is much nicer at the Taylor location.  Prices are very reasonable too.  Sure wish there was one where I have moved to now.

data.title: Great soup!!
data.text: This is our favorite Leon's.  The owner & servers are all very friendly and the prices are reasonable.  We love the soups (soup bar comes with most lunches & dinners).  Thursday's beef barley is worth the trip & the soups are hot too.  Great place & I recommend you give it a try!

data.title: Always very good
data.text: We had a family brunch of 12 adults and 4 kids on a Saturday. We did make reservations. Our tables were ready for us when we arrived. Our server, Nikki, was just Great! She was right there with the coffee for the adults and kept our cups filled without asking. Most ordered the breakfast special and some lunch. The orders came out shortly and not a complaint from the group. Again, a special thanks to Nikki. Your personal touch and great organizational skills make dining at Leon's a pleasure.

data.title: Good home cooking, and a pleasant atmosphere.
data.text: Service was great. Had a comfortable feel to the place. Owner on hand and very friendly. Food was good and so many choices. We had a variety and all was tasty. I will be back to try some other items.

data.title: Soup's On
data.text: This is a nice place if you're looking to have a quiet conversation with decent food. I thought the Lentil soup and the Chicken Gumbo were great, but the Clam Chowder tasted like cream of chicken.  I also had the BLT wrap which was average.  Service was friendly and we did receive our orders quickly.

data.title: Leon's
data.text:
Good family place to eat. Plenty of parking and restaurant was clean and attractive although it needs to be updated. Service was excellent and food was good. Prices are very reasonable and they have a wide selection..

We we're pleases and would eat there again.

data.title: Meals include soup bar
data.text: If you fancy your soups, this is the place for you. They have a daily soup bar with four soups that are all you can eat. The meals are large and filling with a hint of Greek preparation. By the time you try all four soups, you take the meal home. They have a senior discount but the cashier is reluctant to give it to you. Somehow, he says we ordered the special which means no discount. I do not understand the process of discounts. Great soup bar, but nothing stands out about the meals. Service is always great.

data.title: Family friendly place
data.text: There was a group of 10 of us for a Sunday brunch.  We called ahead and got a table away from other tables.  Very nice and quiet so we could talk back/forth. Some ordered breakfast, mainly omelette' w/hashbrowns and others dinners and sandwiches.  No complaints.  Everyone was well satisfied with the atmosphere, the food and the location.  Will return.  It was a family gathering.

data.title: Christmas party
data.text: We eat here all the time but my husband's family just had our Christmas party here and they did a great job and let us take our time.

data.title: Very disappointing.
data.text: Last Saturday our exercise group went to Leon's.  There were husbands and wives, singles and families totaling 19 people.  I checked the breakfast bar before sitting down.  It was small with not many hot items but the fruit bar looked good. I passed on the breakfast bar and ordered from the menu.  I ordered the eggs Benedict with extra hollandaise sauce.    It was very good.  Almost all of us had coffee and it came right away.  Our orders were put in and little by little, they came to the table some much quicker than others.    Everyone had been served except one of our membors and his wife.  They both ordered waffles and sausage but it didn't come with the others. They asked the waitress and she said it will be right up.  More time and she was asked again.  She apologized saying it should be ready soon.  More time, still no food.  The waitress was asked a third time.  Almost everyone was finished with their meal but no waffles or sausage.  Finally, when people were starting to leave, their food was served.  Obviously, their order ticket was lost and absolutely nothing was done to correct the problem.  It was at this time, we learned there was only one cook for a busy Saturday morning.  WHY?  As a my buddy and I were paying for our meal, we were talking about how nice the restaurant was for giving seniors a !0% discount.  My buddy was given the 10%.  My discount was not taken, as I was told, I did not ask for it, even though we were just talking about it right in front of the cashier.   He absolutely refused but since there were many people in line, he finally consented.  I later learned the husband and wife were made to pay full price for their meal, not free nor discounted and no apology.   It should be noted, the waitress did the best she could under these circumstances.  I feel the management needs a customer service realignment.  Almost all of the exercise group agreed, never again.

data.title: Good Food!
data.text: We go there about once a month and ALWAYS get the broasted chicken dinner. It takes a little longer to cook, but is well worth the wait!

data.title: Always good
data.text:
The breakfast special and buffet are always very good.  The buffet is kept fresh and clean.  The menu items are good quality and value.
Most of the staff are efficiant and personable and the owners can always be seen interacting with guests or working.
Great place for informal gatherings of up to 25, too.
